list.name: xray
statements: 100 - employs a technique to visualize bone structures
101 - captured its first image of a hand
102 - was discovered by Wilhelm Conrad Roentgen
103 - is often the first test done for injuries involving fractures
104 - used in dental assessments to detect cavities and root problems

list.name: ultrasound
statements: 105 - uses high-frequency sound waves to produce images of the body
106 - is used to monitor fetal development
107 - safe for imaging soft tissues compared to other imaging modalities
108 - does not use ionizing radiation
109 - ideal for real-time imaging results

list.name: mri
statements: 110 - uses a magnetic field and radio waves to produce images of the body
111 - provides high-resolution images of soft tissues
112 - useful for diagnosing brain disorders
113 - is not recommended for patients with metal implants
114 - ideal for imaging joint structures and soft tissue injuries

list.name: ct
statements: 115 - uses a technique to produce cross-sectional images of the body
116 - provides detailed images of bones and soft tissues
117 - involves a rotating x-ray machine with speeds up to 0.28 seconds per rotation
118 - is often used in emergency situations for quick diagnosis
119 - can be used to guide biopsies and other procedures

list.name: diabetes
statements: 120 - is a chronic condition that affects glucose metabolism
121 - Type 1 diabetes is characterized by the absence of insulin production
122 - Type 2 diabetes often results from body's resistance to insulin
123 - can lead to serious complications like heart disease, kidney damage, and vision loss
124 - is manageable with diet, exercise, and medication

list.name: alzheimer
statements: 125 - is a progressive brain disorder that slowly destroys memory and thinking skills
126 - is the most common cause of dementia among older adults
127 - has no current cure, but treatments for symptoms are available
128 - risk factors include age, genetics, and certain lifestyle factors
129 - early symptoms are often mistaken for normal aging

list.name: coronary artery disease
statements: 130 - is the most common type of heart disease
131 - occurs when the organ supplying blood to the heart become hardened and narrowed
132 - can lead to chest pain, heart attack, or stroke
133 - risk factors include smoking, high cholesterol, and high blood pressure
134 - treatment often involves lifestyle changes, medications, and sometimes surgical procedures

list.name: asthma
statements: 135 - is a chronic condition that inflames and narrows the airways
136 - symptoms include wheezing, shortness of breath, chest tightness, and coughing
137 - triggers can include pollen, dust mites, smoke, and cold air
138 - management involves avoiding triggers and using prescribed inhalers
139 - can vary in intensity and may require emergency treatment

list.name: breast cancer
statements: 140 - is a type of cancer that forms in the cells of the breast
141 - is the most common type of cancer overall with an estimated 310,720 women and 2,790 men will be diagnosed with breast cancer in 2024
142 - genetic factors like BRCA1 and BRCA2 mutations increase risk
143 - mammograms are used for early detection
144 - a lumpectomy or mastectomy may be recommended for treatment

list.name: HIPAA
statements: 150 - stands for Health Insurance Portability and Accountability Act
151 - protects the privacy of patient health information
152 - requires healthcare providers to secure patient records
153 - includes provisions to prevent healthcare fraud
154 - patients can request copies of their health records under this act

list.name: informed consent
statements: 155 - a legal process to ensure patients are aware of all treatment risks
156 - requires clear explanation of the procedures and risks involved before treatment
157 - patients must voluntarily agree to treatment after receiving all relevant information
158 - can be withdrawn by the patient at any time
159 - essential for ethical medical practices

list.name: EMR
statements: 160 - stands for Electronic Medical Record
161 - digitally records patient’s medical history
162 - used primarily within one healthcare practice
163 - can be shared electronically with other healthcare providers with proper consent
164 - enhances efficiency of patient care management

list.name: telemedicine
statements: 165 - the remote diagnosis and treatment of patients via telecommunications technology
166 - helps reach patients in remote areas
167 - includes consultations via video calls
168 - can offer follow-up visits, and remote chronic disease management
169 - requires secure internet connections to protect patient privacy

list.name: patient-centered care
statements: 170 - focuses on the patient’s specific health needs and desired outcomes
171 - involves the patient in all healthcare decisions
172 - recognizes the patient’s preferences, values, and family situations
173 - encourages active collaboration among healthcare teams to meet patient needs
174 - associated with improved patient satisfaction and outcomes

list.name: enhanced data security
statements: 175 - utilizes blockchain technology to ensure data is immutable and tamper-proof
176 - encrypts patient data to prevent unauthorized access
177 - allows secure sharing of medical records between authorized parties
178 - reduces the risk of data breaches compared to traditional data storage systems
179 - supports compliance with data protection regulations

list.name: improved patient control over health data
statements: 180 - enables patients to own and control their medical records
181 - patients can grant or revoke access to their health data at any time
182 - facilitates patient consent management through smart contracts
183 - empowers patients by giving them visibility into who accesses their information
184 - promotes patient privacy and autonomy

list.name: streamlined clinical trials
statements: 185 - blockchain can securely manage consent forms and trial data
186 - facilitates real-time data collection and sharing among trial participants
187 - enhances the reliability and validity of trial results
188 - allows for more efficient recruitment and retention of trial participants
189 - reduces administrative costs and errors associated with clinical trials

list.name: faster and more efficient billing
statements: 190 - smart contracts can automate billing processes, reducing delays
191 - ensures transparency and accuracy transactions
192 - reduces fraud and disputes in billing
193 - decreases administrative costs associated with manual billing systems
194 - enhances patient satisfaction with quicker billing resolution

list.name: global health data interoperability
statements: 195 - facilitates seamless exchange of health information across borders
196 - supports global health monitoring and response efforts
197 - enhances collaborative research and healthcare delivery
198 - overcomes traditional barriers of data silos and incompatible systems
199 - promotes a unified standard for health data that aids in worldwide healthcare improvement
